summary: This is a motion in limine filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team seeking to exclude evidence related to 'Accuser-3' from her criminal trial. The motion argues that Accuser-3 was not a minor under UK law during the alleged encounters, that no illegal travel was induced, and therefore her testimony is irrelevant, inadmissible under Rule 404(b), and unfairly prejudicial. The defense requests exclusion or, alternatively, strict limitations on how the testimony is presented to the jury.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, accused of conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to entice minors to travel for illegal sexual activity. Her defense team is filing this motion to exclude evidence.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier. The motion states he is alleged to have engaged in sex acts with Accuser-3, but the defense argues these acts were legal as she was above the UK age of consent.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP representing Ghislaine Maxwell, a signatory on this motion.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney from Haddon, Morgan & Foreman P.C. representing Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Laura A. Menninger
persons.context: Attorney from Haddon, Morgan & Foreman P.C. representing Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney from Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim representing Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: The indictment alleges Maxwell conspired with Epstein to entice minors to travel for illegal sexual activity. This motion disputes that Accuser-3's allegations support this conspiracy.
Everdell is one of the lead attorneys filing this motion on behalf of defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.
Pagliuca is listed as an attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell on this motion.
Menninger is listed as an attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell on this motion.
Sternheim is listed as an attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell on this motion.

events.title: Alleged grooming and abuse of Accuser-3 begins
events.description: The indictment alleges Maxwell began grooming and befriending Accuser-3 in London, introducing her to Epstein and arranging interactions.

events.title: Alleged sexual encounters between Epstein and Accuser-3
events.description: The period during which Accuser-3 alleges she engaged in sex acts with Jeffrey Epstein in London.

events.title: Original Indictment filed
events.description: The original indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell was filed, including allegations related to Accuser-3.

events.title: First Superseding Indictment (S1) filed
events.description: The first superseding indictment was filed, repeating allegations about Accuser-3.

events.title: Court denies motion to strike
events.description: The court issued an opinion and order denying Maxwell's motion to strike allegations about Accuser-3 from the indictment, reserving the issue for trial.

events.title: Motion in Limine filed
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team files this motion in limine to exclude evidence related to Accuser-3.

keyFacts: The defense argues 'Accuser-3' was above the age of consent (16) in the United Kingdom during the alleged encounters with Jeffrey Epstein in 1994-1995, meaning the alleged sex acts were not illegal under UK law.

The defense states the government concedes Accuser-3 cannot establish she was a minor when she allegedly traveled to the United States (Florida, USVI, New York) at Epstein and Maxwell's invitation, or when she engaged in sex acts there.

The motion claims the government included Accuser-3's allegations in the indictment based on a mistaken belief she was a minor, as indicated by grand jury testimony from an FBI Special Agent and an NYPD Detective.

The defense seeks to preclude the government and Accuser-3 from using the terms 'minor' and 'sexually abused' in relation to Accuser-3, arguing these terms are legally inaccurate and misleading to a jury.

The document reveals the charged conspiracies are Mann Act violations (Counts One and Three), specifically conspiring to entice minors to travel for unlawful sexual activity and to transport a minor with intent for unlawful sexual activity.
